name: 100 Foot Rope
description: Easily affixed to an adventurer's pack. Holds up to 1000 pounds of weight.

name: Fishing Net
description: Suitable for catching fish or restraining opponents in combat.

name: Lockpick
description: For opening locks without the key. Not sold by decent folk.

name: Musical Instrument
description: An instrument such as a guitar, banjo, lute, or dulcimer. Not included: the skill to play it.

name: Candle
description: Lasts 1 hour; emits only dim light.

name: Lantern
description: Requires oil. Emits bright light to a radius of 30 feet when the hood is removed.

name: Torch
description: Lasts 4 hours

name: Workman's Hammer
description: An ordinary ball-peen hammer.

name: Pickaxe
description: Ideal for dislodging rocks and dirt.

name: Climbing Gear
description: Includes 10 pitons, 3 carabiners, and a harness

name: Scissors
description: Suitable for cutting cloth or paper

name: Portable Alchemy Set
description: Allows brewing potions, though less reliably so than a proper alchemical laboratory.

name: Steel Looking Glass
description: A finely polished steel mirror.

name: Looking Glass
description: A genuine glass mirror with silvered backing. No undead or unholy visage shall appear in its frame.

name: Spyglass
description: Allows viewing distant objects at 4x magnification.

name: Spectacles
description: For reading comfort, or restoring sight to the nearsighted adventurer.

name: Magnifying Glass
description: An oddity. Of great use to those inclined to scrutinize objects.

name: Map
description: Conveys a general sense of surrounding terrain.

name: Compass
description: Always points north, except in the presence of magical fields.

name: Navigational Tools
description: An astrolabe and sextant, used by mariners to determine approximate positioning ascertain the distance to landmarks of known height.

name: Ruler
description: Measures lengths, up to 12 inches.

name: Needle & Thread
description: A needle and 100 feet of thread wound around a spindle, for sewing.

name: Crowbar
description: Invented by workmen, for prying. A favorite of thieves and hoodlums galore.

name: Tinderbox
description: For starting fire. If one is in your possession, you may light a torch, candle, or lantern as an action.

name: Disguise Kit
description: For changing one's appearance.

name: Abacus
description: Used to perform advanced arithmetical calculations, provided one has learned its use.

name: Block & Tackle
description: For lifting weight and multiplying effort when hoisting with ropes.

name: Medical Kit
description: Includes bandages, sutures, and antiseptic. +2 to medicine checks while in inventory, or may be used to provide 2d6 healing during a short rest.

name: Hourglass
description: Measures out the passage of an hour. Accurate to within one minute.

name: Ladder
description: 10 foot, when unfolded. Holds up to 300 pounds.

name: Padlock & Key
description: For securing valuables, or denying entry.

name: Metal Pole
description: A hollow metal rod ten foot in length and one inch in diameter. Useful for detecting and disarming traps.

name: Frying Pan
description: For frying eggs. Oft improvised as a weapon of housewives, against intruders.

name: Quiver
description: Holds up to 24 arrows or crossbow bolts.

name: Ram
description: For when lockpicks fail. Allows 2-4 adventurers to combine their strength score when breaking down a door.

name: Shovel
description: For uncovering treasure, or hiding evidence.

name: Whistle
description: Emits a shrill noise, often to alert of danger.

name: Dog Whistle
description: Dogs may be trained to respond to its signal in a specific way. Typical commands: come, attack, heel, or fetch.

name: Whetstone
description: For sharpening knives and blades.

name: Tent
description: Suitable for two adventurers, or one royal highness.

name: Forgery Kit
description: Contains stationery, pens, and inks of various sorts, for falsifying signatures.

name: Chisel
description: For shaping stone and wood. Best when combined with a workman's hammer.
